content.question: Which of the following is the most effective action that a president can pursue to address the issue of improper payments, as shown in the table?

choices.label: The president can require the relevant cabinet secretaries to devise a plan to address the issue of improper payments.
The president can negotiate with Congress to reduce the levels of improper payments in the budget.
The president can negotiate with Congress to address the levels of improper payments in the budget.
The president can issue a signing statement that reduces the payments for these programs.

content.answer: The president can require the relevant cabinet secretaries to devise a plan to address the issue of improper payments.
